result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rorey Alexander Perry

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rorey Alexander Perry in court.  Attorney Dennis P Coffey in court for Rorey Alexander Perry.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Alexander James Geocaris for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 and 2: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 
Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) without recommendation, signed and filed. 

Case is adjourned for sentencing. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 091291,
Payable Number: 1034694,
Receipt Number: 22RP038608,
Amount: $20.00
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Rorey Alexander Perry in court with Attorney Coffey.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference. The matter was HELD OFF THE RECORD.  Defense request an adjournment.  The matter was adjourned to Branch 25.
 All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 316 of the Safety Building.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cash bail on deposit to be returned to the remittur.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.

Defendant Rorey Alexander Perry in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/18/22 @ 1:30p
